channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rookie Reply: House Hacking 101! Which Property to Buy & How to Scale Fast
item.description: House hacking might be the easiest way to get into real estate. This beginner-friendly investing strategy involves little risk, works with several types of properties, and can cover your entire […]

item.title: 360 One lifts its valuation of India’s National Stock Exchange to $29.9B
item.description: 360 One Asset, an investor in National Stock Exchange (NSE), has increased its valuation for India's top stock exchange to $29.9 billion. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Prosecutors Fight Exonerations
item.description: As laws are passed to support the wrongfully convicted, some officials in the legal system push back.

item.title: BiggerNews: Have the Airbnb Bans Backfired on Big Cities?
item.description: Are Airbnb bans actually hurting renters, homebuyers, and your local economy? The truth doesn’t seem so obvious, but new data shows the unintended consequences of banning Airbnbs and short-term rentals, […]

item.title: Get in on the ground floor with Tesla’s humanoid by pretending to be one for pay
item.description: Tesla is hiring individuals standing between 5’7 and 5’11 to carry up to 30 pounds for seven hours a day to train its Optimus robot. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FAQ: How The Marshall Project Is Covering the 2024 Election
item.description: Learn more about who we are and how we choose what political stories to cover.

item.title: Buying at the Peak, Surviving a Crash, and STILL Being Able to Quit at 38
item.description: Have you ever made a poor financial decision? You’re not alone! But can a bad blunder disqualify you from FIRE? Today’s guest made a huge investment at the worst possible […]

item.title: DeepMind workers sign letter in protest of Google’s defense contracts
item.description: At least 200 workers at DeepMind, Google’s AI R&D division, are displeased with Google’s reported defense contracts — and according to Time, they circulated a letter internally back in May to say as much. The letter, dated May 16, says the undersigned are concerned by “Google’s contracts with military organizations,” citing articles about the tech […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Mother on a Mission for Full Police Transparency
item.description: Troy, Alabama, police severely beat Ulysses Wilkerson when he was 17. Seven years later, his mom, Angela Williams, is still fighting for answers.

item.title: VP Harris Wants to Stop Wall Street Homebuying, But Will It Help Regular Buyers?
item.description: Kamala Harris has a plan to make it easier for first-time homebuyers to buy a house, but it comes at the expense of institutional investors. Eviction filings surge throughout the […]

item.title: NASA to decide Saturday whether astronauts will ride Boeing’s Starliner home — or use SpaceX’s Dragon instead
item.description: NASA officials will announce their final decision on Saturday as to whether two NASA astronauts — Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams — will return to Earth on Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft or hitch a ride home with SpaceX instead — a decision that could have a huge impact across the rapidly evolving space industry. Here’s the […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How the 1968 DNC in Chicago Devolved into ‘Unrestrained and Indiscriminate Police Violence’
item.description: As protesters prepare for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago next week, a half-century old report provides lessons for preventing chaos.

item.title: Rentals Cool—Here’s Where Concessions Are Picking Up
item.description: The rental market has been on a downward trajectory for a while, but now a third of landlords are offering concessions.

item.title: Gimbal Space takes on legacy suppliers with fast-paced component supply chain
item.description: America’s space industry seems mature, but the supply chain that provides all the parts and components for rockets, satellites, and other spacecraft is considerably less so. Gimbal Space is aiming to change that, starting with components in the crucial subsystem that enables a spacecraft to orient itself in space — but delivered cheaper and a whole […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Aaron Sankin is The Marshall Project’s new Deputy Data Editor
item.description: Sankin brings deep experience with ambitious data projects.
